title: 105_hr3186
content: The "Rogue River National Forest Interchange Act of 1998" is a legislation involving land transfers in Oregon. The "Rogue River National Forest Interchange Act of 1998" involves transferring approximately 2,058.35 acres of public domain lands in Oregon to the Rogue River National Forest. Administrative jurisdiction over these lands is transferred from the Secretary of the Interior to the Secretary of Agriculture for administration under National Forest laws and regulations. Approximately 1,555.15 acres of Federal lands within the National Forest are transferred to unreserved public domain status. Administrative jurisdiction over these lands is transferred from the Secretary of Agriculture to the Secretary of the Interior for administration under applicable laws and regulations. The Federal lands within the National Forest are restored to revested railroad grant lands, with administrative jurisdiction transferred to the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary of the Interior administers revested Oregon and California railroad grant lands under applicable laws. Approximately 959.67 acres are added to the National Forest, with administrative jurisdiction transferred from the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary of Agriculture will administer lands transferred from the Secretary of the Interior as part of the National Forest, following National Forest laws. Timber resources and revenues from these lands will be managed under the Act of August 28, 1937. The Secretaries of the Interior and Agriculture will update public land records to reflect changes made by this transfer. The Secretaries will publish notice of administrative jurisdiction changes for lands described in this section.
